meanings.definition: A large cell in a developing embryo that gives rise to other cells
meanings.sent1: The macromere divided to form different types of cells in the embryo.
meanings.sent2: During embryonic development, the macromere plays a crucial role in cell differentiation.
meanings.sent3: The macromere was like a busy factory producing various cell types in the embryo.
meanings.sent4: The macromere acted as a master chef, creating a diverse menu of cells in the embryo.
meanings.sent5: The macromere was the architect of cellular diversity in the developing embryo.

meanings.definition: One of the larger cells in a group of cells that divide during embryonic development
meanings.sent1: Among the cells dividing in the embryo, the macromere stood out as one of the largest.
meanings.sent2: The macromere's size made it easily distinguishable from the other dividing cells during development.
meanings.sent3: The macromere was like the big sibling overseeing the division of cells in the embryo.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of dividing cells, the macromere was the giant guiding the process.
meanings.sent5: The macromere was a gentle giant among the dividing cells in embryonic development.
